creator: bluemoon@xs4all.nl
text:
Ant crashes the JVM.
Ant 1.5.4 doesn't crash the JVM. 
Ant 1.6.2 crashes the JVM repeatedly with the following output:

scripts:
   [delete] Deleting: /projecten/Sonneveld/develop/bin/editor.bat
   [delete] Deleting: /projecten/Sonneveld/develop/bin/editor
 
An unexpected exception has been detected in native code outside the VM.
Unexpected Signal : 11 occurred at PC=0x0
Function=[Unknown.]
Library=(N/A)
 
NOTE: We are unable to locate the function name symbol for the error
      just occurred. Please refer to release documentation for possible
      reason and solutions.

#
# The exception above was detected in native code outside the VM
#

Aborted
[kkuip]#

wow. JVM crashes are rare. which is good, because there is nothing any of us can
do to fix them. And Class.forName() too. That means somehow trying to load a
class is crashing the entire JVM with a bug in the runtime (PC=0x0 means that we
have jumped to 0000:0000 ; null pointer bug usually, though things like faulty
memory can cause defects like this sometimes)

This may be something to take up with your JVM vendor. Try filing a bugrep at
sun to see what their response is.

It looks like you are running 1.4.2.07 from Sun. Is there a later release to try
(like the 1.5.0 branch?)

Try Ant1.6.3 too. To be honest, the 1.6 release (and all successors) has the
same shared new classloader stuff, but it all test and works on most machines.

-steve

ps: which linux distro?
creator: stevel@apache.org

text:
Kees,

are you still having this problem? JVM crashes are pretty hard to deal with,
because its invariably a bug in the ant JVM, or some box-specific memory, HDD or
configuration thing.
creator: stevel@apache.org

text: Closing this as it is a bug in the jvm not ant
creator: peterreilly@apache.org
